items.title: El Ahmadi hard over Feyenoord: 'Alsof je naar de nummer achttien kijkt'
items.summary: Feyenoord speelde zondagmiddag een belabberde eerste helft tegen FC Twente. Bij rust stond het 'maar' 0-1 voor de bezoekers, maar dat had een stuk hoger uit kunnen vallen. Analytici Karim El Ahmadi en Bram van Polen oordeelden keihard in de rust.

items.title: Eerst kritiek, daarna lof voor Pepi: 'Hier staat hij voor, een topspitsengoal'
items.summary: Ricardo Pepi speelt niet zijn beste wedstrijd in dienst van PSV. De spits komt tegen FC Utrecht nauwelijks in het spel voor. ESPN-analyticus vertelt waar het aan schort in Stadion Galgenwaard.

items.title: Bosz zag PSV na goede start wegzakken: 'Een beetje het euvel van de laatste tijd'
items.summary: Dat PSV met een overwinning en een nieuw record de winterstop ingaat, stemde trainer Peter Bosz tevreden. Hij vond dat zijn ploeg twee tandjes moest bijschakelen na een slordige fase, waarin FC Utrecht de leiding nam. Voor Joey Veerman was het mogelijk zijn laatste wedstrijd voor PSV, maar Bosz wilde niet zeggen of zijn wissel daarmee te maken had.

items.summary: âš½ Discussion, news and buildup to all Sundayâ€™s action âš½ Live scores | Tables | Saturdayâ€™s reports | Mail us here Thereâ€™s some interesting debate raging below the line about the tempestuous meeting between Tottenham and Liverpool last night, where Xavi Simons and Cristian Romero were sent off but Micky van de Ven, whose challenge ended Alexander Isakâ€™s involvement was not. I donâ€™t think itâ€™s exceptional force. We have the refereeâ€™s call and that was a yellow, so thatâ€™s why I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s a red.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: VI Live: Jans blikt terug op kalenderjaar FC Utrecht, Til blij met productie
items.summary: PSV sluit zondag het jaar af met een uitwedstrijd tegen FC Utrecht. Om 12.15 uur is de aftrap van het duel. Volg de ontmoeting tussen Utrecht en PSV in deze VI Live.

items.title: VI Live: Feyenoord uitgejoeld in De Kuip na zwakke eerste helft
items.summary: Feyenoord krijgt zondag bezoek van FC Twente. De Rotterdammers verloren drie wedstrijden op rij en azen dus op eerherstel. Zeker na de bekerexit van deze week tegen SC Heerenveen. Volg het duel met FC Twente in deze VI Live.

items.title: Lightning strikes twice! Schaper wins again via play-off eagle in Mauritius
items.summary: Jayden Schaper secured his second DP World Tour title in as many weeks after a hole-out eagle at the second play-off hole saw him win the AfrAsia Bank Mauritius Open.

items.title: MbappÃ© equals Ronaldo record, hits 'Siu' celeb
items.summary: Kylian MbappÃ© added his name to another line in the record books on Saturday, tying Cristiano Ronaldo for the most goals by a Real Madrid player in a calendar year.

items.title: Barcelona's Christensen sidelined with ACL injury
items.summary: Andreas Christensen faces a long spell on the sidelines after suffering an ACL injury.

items.title: Isak injured while scoring in Liverpool win at Spurs
items.summary: Liverpool forward Alexander Isak could be facing a lengthy spell on the sidelines after suffering an injury in his team's Premier League clash with Tottenham Hotspur.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal unfazed by Man City title charge
items.summary: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal were not distracted by Manchester City moving top of the Premier League before the Gunners reclaimed number one spot hours later with a 1-0 win at Everton.

items.title: Taylor sorry for 'blatant lying' after failed drugs test
items.summary: Dom Taylor has apologised for "blatant lying" after he was thrown out of the World Darts Championship for failing a drugs test at the tournament.

items.title: Aston Villa couldn't be crowned Premier League champions, could they?
items.summary: Aston Villa started poorly but they're now in running for the Premier League title. Can they sustain a challenge, and are they the 2024 Kansas City Chiefs of soccer?

items.title: Hearts two up on Rangers as Nancy looks for Celtic win vs Aberdeen LIVE!
World Darts Championship: 'The Rockstar' Cullen in action with Cross to come LIVE!
Where did England go wrong in dismal bid to regain Ashes?
items.summary: England's bid to regain the Ashes is over after three comprehensive defeats in the first three Tests of the five-match series in Australia, but where did it all go wrong for Ben Stokes' side?

items.title: Kings or kingmakers? Villa entering decisive run
items.summary: Aston Villa have won nine straight matches to emerge as title contenders despite a poor start to the season. Could 2026 be their year?

items.title: â€˜I made such a bondâ€™: Jesse Lingard on life in South Korea and his next challenge
items.summary: Former Manchester United player discusses culinary and cultural surprises, feeling more mature and how he learned Korean Jesse Lingard says his Korean is decent, good enough to make himself understood when out for dinner and the shocks do not stop there. The former Manchester United and England midfielder was always going to throw himself into his K-League adventure with FC Seoul and now that it is over after two years, a new chapter beckoning when the January transfer window opens, the 33-year-old certainly has the tales to tell. It was the little things as much as anything else, the cultural quirks. And the bigger ones, of course â€“ such as the time he watched an octopus squirm in front of him before eating it. â€œThe food is different, obviously, and I tried live octopus,â€ Lingard says. â€œIt was moving. I was scared at first but it was all right.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: â€˜We feel excludedâ€™: expensive tickets and Trumpâ€™s shadow dampen World Cup excitement in Mexico
items.summary: The feeling among fans is anticlimatic as â€˜businessmen have appropriated the ball that used to belong to the peopleâ€™ Jonathan Zamora was seven years old the last time Mexico hosted the World Cup in 1986. â€œI witnessed perhaps one of the most sublime moments in the history of football,â€ he says, retelling a story that has become a pillar of his life. Zamora, a Mexican football fan, does not remember how his father, Antonio, got tickets to the 1986 World Cup quarter-final between Argentina and England at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City. But he does clearly remember the goals: first when Diego Maradona used his â€œhand of Godâ€ to push the ball past England goalkeeper Peter Shilton. And then the â€œgoal of the centuryâ€, where the Argentinian went on a slalom run, dribbling past half the England team before scoring. Continue reading...

items.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
items.summary: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?
